title: Implement status naming convention
description:
## Task: Update Status Names in Code

Implement the agreed-upon status naming convention.

## Status Types

```typescript
type SkillSyncStatus = 'ok' | 'ahead' | 'behind' | 'unlinked' | 'conflict'
```

## Display

| Status | Badge | Color | Meaning |
|--------|-------|-------|---------|
| ok | `[✓]` | green | Symlinked, up to date |
| ahead | `[ahead]` | yellow | Symlinked, local has unpushed changes |
| behind | `[behind]` | cyan | Symlinked, library has updates |
| unlinked | `[unlinked]` | dim | Real file = library (safe to sync) |
| conflict | `[conflict]` | red | Real file ≠ library (choose action) |

LOCAL section: skills not in library (push first)
AVAILABLE section: skills in library, not installed

## Actions per Status

- `[✓]` → `[u]ninstall`
- `[ahead]` → `[p]ush`, `[u]ninstall`
- `[behind]` → `[pull]`, `[u]ninstall`
- `[unlinked]` → `[s]ync`, `[u]ninstall`
- `[conflict]` → `[s]ync` (use library), `[p]ush` (use local)
- LOCAL → `[p]ush`
- AVAILABLE → `[i]nstall`

## Files to Update

- [ ] `src/lib/project.ts` - SkillSyncStatus type and detection logic
- [ ] `src/tui/App.tsx` - StatusBadge and HelpBar components
- [ ] `docs/SKILL-SYNC-VISION.md` - Update status documentation

title: Architecture: Sparse checkout + hard copies
description:
## Overview

Replace symlink-based sync with sparse checkout + hard copies architecture.

## Why

Symlinks have critical issues:
- Non-portable (breaks for non-skillbook users)
- Git noise (symlinks to missing files)
- Cross-platform problems
- Clone doesn't resolve symlinks

## New Architecture

```
~/.config/skillbook/              # Master library (full git repo)
project/.skillbook/               # Sparse checkout (gitignored)
project/.claude/skills/           # Hard copies (committed)
```

## Implementation Phases

### Phase 1: Sparse Checkout Foundation
- [ ] Create .skillbook/ as sparse checkout of master library
- [ ] Auto-add .skillbook/ to .gitignore
- [ ] Create .skillbook/config.yaml for project preferences
- [ ] Update init to use hard copies instead of symlinks

### Phase 2: Sync Commands
- [ ] skillbook status - compare harness <-> library
- [ ] skillbook sync - bidirectional sync
- [ ] skillbook pull - library -> harness
- [ ] skillbook push - harness -> library

### Phase 3: Polish
- [ ] Conflict detection and resolution
- [ ] Diff display before sync
- [ ] Undo support

## Key Design Decisions

1. **No state tracking files** - direct file comparison
2. **Project config in .skillbook/** - per-project harness preferences
3. **Git is enabler, CLI is interface** - users don't need to know git
4. **Harness files are committed** - works for non-skillbook users

See docs/SKILL-SYNC-VISION.md for full architecture details.
close_reason: Duplicate of skill-book-db8

title: Implement eject command
description:
## Overview

`skillbook eject` converts symlinks back to real files and removes .skillbook/.

## Flow

1. Show what will happen
2. Let user select which harnesses to eject to
3. Copy files from .skillbook/skills/ to selected harnesses
4. Remove symlinks
5. Remove .skillbook/ folder

## UI

```
skillbook eject

Ejecting will:
  1. Copy skills to harness folders as real files
  2. Remove symlinks
  3. Remove .skillbook/ folder

You can run skillbook again anytime to re-setup.

Which harnesses to eject to?
  [x] opencode
  [ ] claude-code  (no symlinks exist)
  [ ] cursor

[Enter] Confirm  [Esc] Cancel
```

## Implementation

- `ejectSkill(projectPath, skillName, harnesses)` - copy to harnesses, remove symlinks
- `ejectAll(projectPath, harnesses)` - eject all skills
- `removeSkillbook(projectPath)` - remove .skillbook/ folder

## Edge Cases

- What if harness already has real file? Skip or overwrite?
- What if .skillbook has uncommitted changes? Warn user?

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Can select harnesses to eject to
- [ ] Symlinks converted to real files
- [ ] .skillbook/ removed
- [ ] Running skillbook again shows read-only mode

title: Improve bulk add status and conflict display logic
description:
## Overview

Refactor the bulk add command to properly handle status and conflict indicators based on the relationship between project files and the library.

## Current Problems

1. `[synced] ⚠ duplicate` makes no sense - synced files are identical to library, so identical to each other
2. No diff information shown for `[changed]` status
3. "Duplicate" is misleading - should indicate actual content conflicts, not just same name

## Status Definitions

| Status | Meaning |
|--------|---------|
| `[new]` | Skill name NOT in library |
| `[synced]` | Skill name in library AND content IDENTICAL |
| `[changed +N/-M]` | Skill name in library AND content DIFFERS (show git-style diff) |

## Conflict Logic

**Key insight**: Status and Conflict are NOT orthogonal.

- `[synced]` can NEVER have conflict (by definition, all synced files match library, thus match each other)
- `[new]` CAN have conflict (multiple projects, different content)
- `[changed]` CAN have conflict (multiple projects, different changes)

### Conflict indicator rules:

```
Show "⚠ N versions" only when:
1. Same skill name in 2+ locations AND
2. NOT all synced AND
3. Content actually differs between locations
```

## Display Matrix

### A) Skill NOT in library

| Locations | Content | Display |
|-----------|---------|---------|
| 1 project | - | `[new]` |
| 2+ projects | All identical | `[new]` (pick any) |
| 2+ projects | Different | `[new] ⚠ N versions` |

### B) Skill IN library

| Locations | Content vs Library | Display |
|-----------|-------------------|---------|
| 1 project | Same | `[synced]` |
| 1 project | Different | `[changed +N/-M]` |
| 2+ projects | All same as library | `[synced]` |
| 2+ projects | All same but ≠ library | `[changed +N/-M]` |
| 2+ projects | Mixed/different | Individual status + `⚠ N versions` if content differs |

## Implementation Tasks

- [ ] Add diff calculation function (line additions/deletions vs library)
- [ ] Update `SkillStatus` type to include diff stats
- [ ] Update `hasDuplicates` logic to only flag actual content conflicts
- [ ] Update display formatting to show `[changed +N/-M]`
- [ ] Remove conflict indicator for `[synced]` items

## Test Scenarios (Integration Tests Required)

### New skills
- [ ] Single new skill shows `[new]`
- [ ] Multiple locations, same content shows `[new]` (no conflict)
- [ ] Multiple locations, different content shows `[new] ⚠ 2 versions`

### Synced skills
- [ ] Single synced skill shows `[synced]`
- [ ] Multiple synced (same content) shows `[synced]` (NO conflict indicator)

### Changed skills
- [ ] Single changed skill shows `[changed +N/-M]` with correct diff
- [ ] Multiple changed, same changes shows `[changed +N/-M]` (no conflict)
- [ ] Multiple changed, different changes shows `[changed +N/-M] ⚠ 2 versions`

### Mixed scenarios
- [ ] Same skill: 1 synced + 1 changed = changed shows conflict
- [ ] Same skill: 1 new + 1 new different = both show conflict

### Diff accuracy
- [ ] Adding lines shows correct +N
- [ ] Removing lines shows correct -M
- [ ] Mixed changes show correct +N/-M
- [ ] No changes (synced) shows no diff

## Future Enhancements (Not in this PR)

- Config file to track sync metadata (commit hash, timestamp)
- `[outdated]` status when library updated after sync
- `[modified]` status when project changed after sync
- Merge assistance for true conflicts
close_reason: Implemented: DiffStats type, calculateDiff(), conflict logic (synced never shows conflict), [changed +N/-M] display format. 88 tests passing.

title: Architecture: Sparse checkout + symlinks
description:
## Overview

## Architecture

```
├── skills/
│   ├── beads/SKILL.md
│   └── typescript-cli/SKILL.md
└── config.json

project/
├── .skillbook/                   # Sparse checkout of library
│   └── skills/
│       ├── beads/SKILL.md        ← sparse checkout
│       └── typescript-cli/SKILL.md
├── .claude/skills/
│   └── beads/SKILL.md            ← symlink → .skillbook/skills/beads/SKILL.md
├── .opencode/skill/
│   └── beads/SKILL.md            ← symlink
└── .cursor/rules/
    └── beads.md                  ← symlink
```

## Key Decisions

1. **Sparse checkout** - `.skillbook/` is a sparse checkout of the library
2. **Symlinks** - Harness folders contain symlinks to `.skillbook/skills/`
3. **Read-only mode** - When `.skillbook/` not initialized, show current state but no actions
4. **Progressive adoption** - User can migrate some/all skills selectively
5. **Eject** - Convert symlinks back to real files anytime

## User Flow

1. First run (no .skillbook/) → Read-only mode, show legacy files + available
2. User presses "s" to setup → Migration wizard
3. Select skills to migrate → Add to library if needed, sparse checkout, symlink
4. Select harnesses → Create symlinks for each
5. Done → Full functionality (install, uninstall, push, sync)
6. Eject → Back to real files

See docs/SKILL-SYNC-VISION.md for full details.
notes:
## Tracking Status Terminology (Git-Inspired)

Skills have a **tracking status** describing their relationship to the library:

| Status | Label | Meaning |
|--------|-------|---------|
| Not in library | [untracked] | Library doesn't track this skill yet |
| In library, identical | [synced] | Tracked, up to date with library |
| In library, local differs | [ahead +5/-3] | Tracked, local has changes not in library |
| In library, library updated | [behind] | Tracked, library has newer version |
| Both changed | [diverged] | Tracked, both have different changes |

**Context-dependent visibility:**
- add --bulk: untracked, synced, ahead (scans local files only)
- status: All statuses (compares against project config)
- pull: behind, diverged (checks library for updates)

This maps cleanly to git mental model:
- Library = remote/origin
- untracked = git untracked
- synced = git clean/up-to-date
- ahead = git ahead (local has unpushed changes)
- behind = git behind (remote has changes to pull)
- diverged = git diverged (both changed)

title: Implement ahead/behind state detection
description:
## Overview

Detect when local .skillbook/ has changes not yet pushed to library (ahead) or library has changes not pulled (behind).

## Current State

- Statuses `[ahead]` and `[behind]` are defined in types but not detected
- Currently all symlinked skills show as `[✓]` (ok)

## Implementation

### Ahead Detection
Compare .skillbook/ git status with library:
- Check if .skillbook/ has uncommitted changes
- Check if .skillbook/ has commits not in library

### Behind Detection  
Compare library HEAD with .skillbook/:
- Fetch library remote (if configured)
- Check if library has commits not in .skillbook/

## UI Changes

- `[ahead +N/-M]` - yellow badge showing diff stats
- `[behind]` - cyan badge
- Actions: `[p]ush` for ahead, `[l]pull` for behind

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Detect uncommitted changes in .skillbook/ as ahead
- [ ] Detect unpushed commits as ahead (if remote configured)
- [ ] Detect library updates as behind
- [ ] Show appropriate badges in TUI
- [ ] Add push/pull actions

title: Implement skillbook add command
description:
Implement the `skillbook add <path>` command.

## Command Interface

```bash
skillbook add <path> [--name <name>] [--force]

Arguments:
  path              Path to skill file (required)

Options:
  --name, -n        Skill name (optional, inferred from path if not provided)
  --force, -f       Overwrite without asking
```

## Implementation Flow

1. **Validate path**: Check file exists and is .md file

2. **Determine skill name**:
   - If --name provided: use it (validate: lowercase, alphanumeric, hyphens, 2-50 chars)
   - Else: extract from path using patterns:
     - `.claude/skills/<name>/SKILL.md` → name
     - `.cursor/rules/<name>.md` → name
     - `.opencode/skills/<name>.md` → name
     - `<folder>/SKILL.md` → folder name
   - If cannot determine: error with suggestion to use --name

3. **Ensure library exists**:
   - If ~/.config/skillbook doesn't exist:
     - Create directory
     - `git init`
     - Create skills/ subdirectory
     - Initial commit: "Initialize skillbook library"

4. **Check if skill exists in library**:
   - If exists and --force: continue (overwrite)
   - If exists and content identical: skip, print "Skill 'X' already up to date"
   - If exists and differs: prompt "Skill 'X' exists. Overwrite? [y/N]"
   - If not exists: continue

5. **Write skill**:
   - Create skills/<name>/ directory if needed
   - Copy file to skills/<name>/SKILL.md

6. **Git commit**:
   - `git add skills/<name>/SKILL.md`
   - `git commit -m "Add skill: <name>"` (or "Update skill: <name>")

7. **Output**:
   - Success message with library path
   - Show git commit hash for reference

## Name Validation

```typescript
// Valid: beads, typescript, review-gitlab, my-skill-2
// Invalid: Beads, _beads, my skill, a, 123-skill
/^[a-z][a-z0-9-]{1,49}$/
```

## Example Usage

```bash
# Basic usage - name inferred from path
skillbook add .claude/skills/beads/SKILL.md
# ✓ Added skill 'beads' to library (commit: abc123)

# With explicit name
skillbook add ./my-file.md --name typescript
# ✓ Added skill 'typescript' to library (commit: def456)

# Force overwrite
skillbook add .claude/skills/beads/SKILL.md --force
# ✓ Updated skill 'beads' in library (commit: ghi789)

# Identical content
skillbook add .claude/skills/beads/SKILL.md
# ℹ Skill 'beads' already up to date, skipped
```

## Files to Create/Modify

- `src/commands/add.ts` - Main command implementation
- `src/lib/library.ts` - Library operations (init, add skill)
- `src/lib/git.ts` - Git operations (init, commit)
- `src/lib/skills.ts` - Skill name extraction and validation
close_reason: Implemented add command with name extraction, validation, git integration, overwrite handling
